newsitem.title: UK: CYCLING-NEW WORLD TEAM PURSUIT RECORD FOR ITALY.
newsitem.headline: CYCLING-NEW WORLD TEAM PURSUIT RECORD FOR ITALY.

text.p: Italy set a new world record for the 4,000 metres team pursuit in the semifinals of the world championship at Manchester on Saturday.
The Italian quartet's time of 4:00.958 beat the old record of 4:03.840, set by Australia in Hamar, Norway two years ago, by 2.882 seconds.
With their semifinal opponents Russia heading for defeat, Italy's Adler Capelli, Cristiano Citto, Andrea Collinelli and Mauro Trentino eased off in the closing laps but still achieved the record.

Italy, silver medallists in the Olympic team pursuit, face Atlanta gold medallists France in Saturday night's final. The French qualified for the final in 4:05.104 , beating Germany who were awarded the bronze medal as fastest losing semifinalists.
